newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo Aero says wins 300 mln SKR orders.
newsitem.headline: Volvo Aero says wins 300 mln SKR orders.

text.p: Volvo Aero, a unit of Swedish vehicle manufacturer AB Volvo, on Friday said it had won engine orders worth 300 million crowns.

Volvo Aero said in a statement that the orders, for aircraft motors, were a result of deals announced by Boeing, Airbus and McDonnell Douglas at this week's Farnborough International Air Show in Britain.
"Volvo Aero has, as a joint-venture partner in various aircraft motor programmes, won orders which are together worth 300 million crowns," the company said.

Boeing said this week it would sell seven 747-400 jumbo jets to Philippine Airlines in a deal worth $1.18 billion. Lufthansa Cargo AG ordered five McDonnell Douglas Corp MD-11 freighter aircraft and took options on a further seven.
